content: The Memorial Hall for Incheon Landing Operation is a war memorial hall built to commemorate the centennial anniversary of the opening of Incheon Port in 1984.It's also located in Ongnyeon-dong, Yeonsu-gu in Incheon Metropolitan City.

Incheon Landing War Memorial Hall is also a very important place, Incheon Landing Memorial Hall is also a small place, the whole area is also a very fun place, the memorial hall is also a good place for the memorial site in the Korean War, a lot of weapons and equipment.

The location is relatively remote. I took more than an hour's car from Seoul and changed to 4 times before I arrived here. It is free inside, and you can take a free postcard with historical photos. The introduction inside is the process of landing in Incheon, with Chinese.
Very commemorative place, very cost-effective.
I have been there many years ago, and I have not been out of the country after the epidemic. I hope that the epidemic will disperse as soon as possible.

When I got here, I took bus 111-2. The driver dumped the bus and stopped the next stop for us. The Korean driver was unkind, because he took a taxi with the old man. The driver naturally had to put us in a confused place. In order to avoid the old man's tiredness, he went to find it himself. It took a lot of trouble to ask the two young people how they did not know that the landing memorial was on the hillside. After finding it, he borrowed a wheelchair to see MacArthur. Free, next to Incheon Museum. It's different from our original education. It's good to know history.

Visiting here is one of the two main reasons for going to Incheon. (Another is to visit Qingwatai) The memorial hall is located on the hillside. There are two planes outside. It is the season when cherry blossoms wither. The petals fall on the plane in the wind. The indoor exhibition hall has wheelchairs for people in need to use freely. The pictures and detailed campaign process were introduced in Korean, Chinese, English and Japanese respectively. The clothes and glasses used by MacArthur at that time were displayed. Finally, there are objective records of the chairman and the military uniforms of our volunteers on display.

Incheon Landing Campaign Memorial covers a very wide area, if the terrace, it is estimated that it is analogous to the embankment climbed by the Allied soldiers when they landed. On the outdoor booth in the middle are some heavy weapons. At the top are the Freedom Guard Monument. The statues of the three American soldiers look grim. They are indeed American ghosts. So the designer shouldn't be a spy?! Indoor display has the fashionable model unique to small and medium-sized developed countries such as Korea. It introduces in detail the four languages of Korean, English, Chinese and Japanese on all exhibition boards, from the outbreak of the Korean War to the concept of Incheon campaign, until the implementation of the campaign and the first recovery of Seoul by the Allied Forces. Of course, the crushing point is the large sand table of Incheon landing battle. The background of the sand table is the big screen, which visually and vividly reproduces the scene of the landing battle of that year.

Incheon Landing Campaign Memorial Hall covers a very wide area, if the terrace. There are heavy weapons on the outdoor booth in the middle, and at the top is the Freedom Guardian Monument. From the outbreak of the Korean War to the concept of Incheon campaign, until the implementation of the campaign and the first recovery of Seoul by the Allied Forces, all exhibition boards have four languages: Korean, English, Chinese and Japanese. Of course, the crushing point is the large sand table of Incheon landing battle. The background of the sand table is the big screen, which visually and vividly reproduces the landing battle scene of that year.
The solemn place has historical retrospective value.

People who know and care about the history of the war can go in and see, remember that there are several old-fashioned tanks on it. The memorial hall established by the United Army on the shore of Incheon has a lot of things to see, and the traffic is relatively convenient.

The mode of transportation is shown in the figure. I went from Seoul. The traffic takes two hours. It's a bit worthless to see a museum that's not particularly exciting for four hours. There are many ways of transportation, so can bus transfer at Zhu'an Station. Museum is free, mainly divided into three parts: first, the land part, is some sculptures and weapons, weapons less than the Seoul War Museum. Second, the video hall is not open to non-groups. Thirdly, museums have more literary works than cultural relics. MacArthur's glasses and hats are all reproductions. So new a pipe is certainly not a genuine one. The rest are light and heavy weapons, which are not unique. As for the text part, although it is multilingual and has a lot of content, there are many materials on the internet, so you don't have to come to see them deliberately. Only free postcards can be used as a souvenir, with a few McShuai's. It's not worth a visit.

Just like the Red Army Memorial Hall on our side, it tells stories of the Anti-Japanese War and shows the clothes they wore at that time. From the outside, it seems that his building is still very domineering and has a solemn feeling.

If time permits, you can come here to visit. This is a place to commemorate veterans. It is also a very quiet place. There is an introduction in English. There are also some Japanese-style buildings here.

We got off at Dongmu Station on Line 1 of the Metro and then transferred to No. 8 Bus. In order to commemorate the success of Incheon's landing operation, the Memorial Hall shows the history of Incheon's landing operation.

It's only recommended for the past. Line 1 to Incheon Terminus, change to S-line to Matsushima, and wait for the bus is not convenient, we walked directly, foot distance is about 20 minutes, basically a straight line distance, is the climbing distance, see the "Incheon Inland War Memorial" road signs on it. The overall layout does not have the atmosphere of the Korean War Memorial Hall in Seoul, and there are overlaps in the indoor exhibition. It's not too hot to go in the season. If it's midsummer, it's better to take a stroll by the Incheon Sea.

The doorway should be a statue of MacArthur, and when we go, listen to the guide. The South Korean tour guide lamented: "If you China does not interfere, let us decide for ourselves, we will unify South Korea." I lamented: "It is completely correct, if the outside world does not interfere, the Americans do not interfere, North Korea will be unified long ago. "The South Korean tour guide understood what I meant for a long time: "We don't like North Korea, how can they be unified, the Americans are us invited, not interference!" I stared at his glasses and told him: China is North Korea invited, not interference. The Koreans don't like South Koreans. Just now you said there is no foreign interference, then according to history, Naturally, North Korea is unified.

Incheon Landing Operational Memorial Hall, No. 525 Yulian Cave, Yanshou District, Incheon City, is a magnificent war memorial hall opened 25 years ago when Incheon commemorated the 100th anniversary of its harbour opening in 1984. The Memorial elaborates on the achievements of the United Nations led by the United States Army and the heroic battles that highlight Korean officers and soldiers, apparently for propaganda purposes. Looking at the stars carefully, your little buddies must remember that in the first episode, professors who have been on the earth for 400 years have participated in countless times.

This memorial hall is like the Martyrs'Cemetery on our side. There are many stand-by introductions. Of course, they can't understand basically. And even if there are tour guides, what they say is not particularly clear. They can only make a trip here and punch in.

In fact, it is equivalent to a park. There are many models of airplanes and missiles in it. Inside, you can also see a part of Incheon. Anyway, you don't need tickets. It's like a park to walk around. There aren't many people. You can also learn about history. It's good that traffic is a little inconvenient.

It's very interesting to go to Incheon and learn about the other side's explanation of war. It's peaceful and neutral. It's enough to read in an hour. The Incheon Landing War Memorial was established in １９８４, mainly to commemorate the landing battle that changed the geopolitical landscape of Northeast Asia. The memorial covers a large area, there are some weapons displays outside, indoors are the cause and consequence of the battle, and there is a large sand pan for military enthusiasts to see.

To commemorate the success of Incheon's landing operations, the museum shows the history of Incheon's landing operations. Incheon's landing success is also an important turning point in the Korean War.

Incheon landing has played a very turning role in the Korean Civil War and the anti-US and aid to the DPRK. For South Korea, it is also their own understanding of national unity. It will be very different to think about it from another angle.

Incheon Landing Memorial Hall can take Incheon Line 1 to Dongmu Station and then transfer to No. 8 or No. 16 bus directly. Incheon Landing Memorial Hall shows the tanks and artillery used to land in the year.

Re-examine the battle of one in five thousand possible textbook rewrites. Incheon Port is considered impossible for landing operations because it has the largest tidal range in the world, so it is also the weakest port defended by the Korean People's Army. Let's go to Incheon Landing Operations Memorial Hall to review this myth. All the signs in the memorial hall have Korean, English, Japanese and Chinese characters. It's a big park with a good environment around the memorial hall.

Many relics of the Korean War as well as the equipment and configuration of various parties and the situation of several major battles are displayed. Of course, the evaluation of the war in the memorial hall is from the standpoint of Korea and the United States.

There are Chinese explanations inside the exhibition. Chinese people seem to be very convenient. Standing above the memorial hall, you can see the nearby beach of Incheon, the landing site of that year. Looking at it now, it is already a quiet and slightly remote atmosphere.
